name: sireum

subs.name: hamr
subs.header: HAMR: High Assurance Model-based Rapid-engineering tools for embedded systems

opts.name: msgpack
opts.description: Input serialized using Msgpack (otherwise JSON assumed)

opts.name: verbose
opts.description: Enable verbose mode

opts.name: runtimeMonitoring
opts.description: Enable runtime monitoring

opts.name: platform
opts.description: Target platform

opts.name: outputDir
opts.description: Default output directory

opts.name: parseableMessages
opts.description: Print parseable file messages

opts.name: slangOutputDir
opts.description: Output directory for the generated Slang project files

opts.name: packageName
opts.description: Base package name for Slang project

opts.name: noProyekIve
opts.description: Do not run Proyek IVE

opts.name: noEmbedArt
opts.description: Do not embed ART project files

opts.name: devicesAsThreads
opts.description: Treat AADL devices as threads

opts.name: genSbtMill
opts.description: Generate SBT and Mill projects in addition to Proyek

opts.name: slangAuxCodeDirs
opts.description: Auxiliary C source code directories

opts.name: slangOutputCDir
opts.description: Output directory for C artifacts

opts.name: excludeComponentImpl
opts.description: Exclude Slang component implementations, behavior code written in C

opts.name: bitWidth
opts.description: Default bit-width for unbounded integer types (e.g., Z)

opts.name: maxStringSize
opts.description: Size for statically allocated strings

opts.name: maxArraySize
opts.description: Default sequence size (e.g., for ISZ, MSZ

opts.name: runTranspiler
opts.description: Run Transpiler during HAMR Codegen

opts.name: sel4OutputDir
opts.description: Output directory for the generated CAmkES/Microkit project files

opts.name: sel4AuxCodeDirs
opts.description: Directories containing C files to be included in CAmkES/Microkit build

opts.name: workspaceRootDir
opts.description: Root directory containing the architectural model project

opts.name: strictAadlMode
opts.description: Whether to generate strictly AADL-compliant code or not (will probably become obsolete soon)

opts.name: ros2OutputWorkspaceDir
opts.description: The path to the ROS2 workspace to generate the packages into

opts.name: ros2Dir
opts.description: The path to your ROS2 installation, including the version (../ros/humble)

opts.name: ros2NodesLanguage
opts.description: The programming language for the generated node files

opts.name: ros2LaunchLanguage
opts.description: The programming language for the launch file

opts.name: invertTopicBinding
opts.description: By default, topic names are based on in ports, and fan out ports would have multiple publishers.  This option inverts that behavior.

subs.name: phantom
subs.header: Sireum Phantom: Headless OSATE AADL to AIR Translator
subs.usage:
${st"""
|    phantom --update [--osate <path>] [--features <config>] [--sireum-home <path>]
|
|      Just update/install features
|
|or: phantom [<options>] [<project-directory>]
|
|      Generate AIR.  Either:
|        - point to a directory containing a .project or .system file, or
|        - populate the 'projects', 'main-package', and 'sys-impl' options""".render}

opts.name: impl
opts.description: Name of the system implementation.

opts.name: main
opts.description: AADL main package file that contains a system implementation.

opts.name: mode
opts.description: AADL model serialization method

opts.name: output
opts.description: AIR output file path

opts.name: projects
opts.description: OSATE project directories, each must contain an OSATE '.project' file

opts.name: verbose
opts.description: Verbose output

opts.name: verbosePlus
opts.description: Increased verbose output

opts.name: osate
opts.description: Either the path to an existing installation of OSATE, or the path where OSATE should be installed

opts.name: update
opts.description: Update (or install) features

opts.name: features
opts.description: Plugin features to update/install, each of the form <feature-id>=<repo-url-1>,...,<repo-url-N>. Latest Sireum plugins installed if not provided

opts.name: version
opts.description: OSATE version

opts.name: sireum
opts.description: Change the location of the Sireum home installation directory that OSATE uses

subs.header: Sireum HAMR SysML v2 Logika Verifier

opts.name: integrationOnly
opts.description: Only output integration feedback

opts.name: exclude
opts.description: Sourcepath exclusion as URI segment

opts.name: feedback
opts.description: Feedback output directory

opts.name: sourcepath
opts.description: Source paths of SysML v2 .sysml files

opts.name: parseableMessages
opts.description: Print parseable file messages

opts.name: charBitWidth
opts.description: Bit-width representation for C (character) values (expected 8, 16, or 32)

opts.name: fpRounding
opts.description: Rounding mode for floating point numbers

opts.name: useReal
opts.description: Use reals to approximate floating-point numbers

opts.name: intBitWidth
opts.description: Bit-width representation for Z (integer) values (expected 0, 8, 16, 32, 64)

opts.name: interprocedural
opts.description: Enable inter-procedural verification on non-strict-pure methods

opts.name: interproceduralContracts
opts.description: Use contracts in inter-procedural verification

opts.name: strictPureMode
opts.description: Strict-pure method treatment mode in compositional/interprocedural verification

opts.name: line
opts.description: Focus verification to the specified program line number

opts.name: loopBound
opts.description: Loop bound for inter-procedural verification

opts.name: callBound
opts.description: Recursive call-chain bound for inter-procedural verification

opts.name: patternExhaustive
opts.description: Disable pattern exhaustiveness checking

opts.name: pureFun
opts.description: Always add proof functions for pure methods

opts.name: sat
opts.description: Enable assumption satisfiability checking

opts.name: skipMethods
opts.description: Skip checking methods with the specified fully-qualified names or identifiers

opts.name: skipTypes
opts.description: Skip checking traits, classes, and objects with the specified fully-qualified names or identifiers

opts.name: logPc
opts.description: Display path conditions before each statement

opts.name: logPcLines
opts.description: Display At(...) path condition line numbers and unique symbolic value numbering

opts.name: logRawPc
opts.description: Display raw path conditions before each statement

opts.name: logVc
opts.description: Display all verification conditions

opts.name: logVcDir
opts.description: Write all verification conditions in a directory

opts.name: logDetailedInfo
opts.description: Display detailed feedback information

opts.name: logAtRewrite
opts.description: Disable At(...) rewriting as In(...)/Old(...) in symexe mode

opts.name: stats
opts.description: Collect verification statistics

opts.name: par
opts.description: Enable parallelization (with CPU cores percentage to use)

opts.name: branchPar
opts.description: Enable branch parallelization

opts.name: branchParReturn
opts.description: Only use branch parallelization if all branches return

opts.name: branchPredNum
opts.description: Branch parallelization prediction minimum number of branches

opts.name: branchPredComplexity
opts.description: Branch parallelization prediction statement complexity

opts.name: rwPar
opts.description: Enable rewriting parallelization

opts.name: dontSplitFunQuant
opts.description: Do not force splitting in quantifiers and proof functions derived from @strictpure methods

opts.name: splitAll
opts.description: Split all

opts.name: splitContract
opts.description: Split on contract cases

opts.name: splitIf
opts.description: Split on if-conditional expressions and statements

opts.name: splitMatch
opts.description: Split on match expressions and statements

opts.name: rwMax
opts.description: Maximum number of rewriting

opts.name: rwTrace
opts.description: Disable rewriting trace

opts.name: rwEvalTrace
opts.description: Disable evaluation rewriting trace

opts.name: elideEncoding
opts.description: Strip out SMT2 encoding in feedback

opts.name: rawInscription
opts.description: Use raw sequent/sat preamble inscription

opts.name: rlimit
opts.description: SMT2 solver resource limit

opts.name: sequential
opts.description: Disable SMT2 solvers parallelization

opts.name: simplify
opts.description: Simplify SMT2 query (experimental)

opts.name: smt2SatConfigs
opts.description: SMT2 configurations for satisfiability queries

opts.name: smt2ValidConfigs
opts.description: SMT2 configurations for validity queries

opts.name: satTimeout
opts.description: Use validity checking timeout for satisfiability checking (otherwise: 500ms)

opts.name: timeout
opts.description: Timeout (seconds) for validity checking

opts.name: searchPC
opts.description: Search path conditions first before employing SMT2 solvers when discharging VCs

subs.name: proyek

opts.description: Exclude library dependencies

opts.description: Output directory name under <dir>

opts.name: project
opts.description: The project.cmd file accepting the 'json' argument (defaults to <dir>${Os.fileSep}bin${Os.fileSep}project-standalone.cmd, or <dir>${Os.fileSep}bin${Os.fileSep}project.cmd; mutually exclusive with the 'json' option)

opts.description: Slice the project starting from the given module IDs and their dependencies

opts.description: Follow symbolic link when searching for files

opts.description: The properties file(s) containing version information (defaults to <dir>${Os.fileSep}versions.properties)

opts.name: cache
opts.description: Ivy cache directory (defaults to Coursier's default cache directory)

opts.name: docs
opts.description: Disable retrieval of javadoc files from Ivy dependencies

opts.name: sources
opts.description: Disable retrieval of source files from Ivy dependencies

opts.name: proxyHost
opts.description: Proxy host for ivy resolution

opts.name: proxyNonHosts
opts.description: Proxy non-hosts for ivy resolution

opts.name: proxyPort
opts.description: Proxy port for ivy resolution

opts.description: Proxy protocol for ivy resolution

opts.description: Proxy user environment variable for ivy resolution

opts.name: proxyPassword
opts.description: Proxy password environment variable for ivy resolution

opts.name: repositories
opts.description: Additional repository URLs to retrieve Ivy dependencies from

opts.name: infoFlow
opts.description: Enable information flow verification

opts.name: charBitWidth
opts.description: Bit-width representation for C (character) values (expected 8, 16, or 32)

opts.name: fpRounding
opts.description: Rounding mode for floating point numbers

opts.name: useReal
opts.description: Use reals to approximate floating-point numbers

opts.name: intBitWidth
opts.description: Bit-width representation for Z (integer) values (expected 0, 8, 16, 32, 64)

opts.name: interprocedural
opts.description: Enable inter-procedural verification on non-strict-pure methods

opts.name: interproceduralContracts
opts.description: Use contracts in inter-procedural verification

opts.name: strictPureMode
opts.description: Strict-pure method treatment mode in compositional/interprocedural verification

opts.name: line
opts.description: Focus verification to the specified program line number

opts.name: loopBound
opts.description: Loop bound for inter-procedural verification

opts.name: callBound
opts.description: Recursive call-chain bound for inter-procedural verification

opts.name: patternExhaustive
opts.description: Disable pattern exhaustiveness checking

opts.name: pureFun
opts.description: Always add proof functions for pure methods

opts.name: sat
opts.description: Enable assumption satisfiability checking

opts.name: skipMethods
opts.description: Skip checking methods with the specified fully-qualified names or identifiers

opts.name: skipTypes
opts.description: Skip checking traits, classes, and objects with the specified fully-qualified names or identifiers

opts.name: logPc
opts.description: Display path conditions before each statement

opts.name: logPcLines
opts.description: Display At(...) path condition line numbers and unique symbolic value numbering

opts.name: logRawPc
opts.description: Display raw path conditions before each statement

opts.name: logVc
opts.description: Display all verification conditions

opts.name: logVcDir
opts.description: Write all verification conditions in a directory

opts.name: logDetailedInfo
opts.description: Display detailed feedback information

opts.name: logAtRewrite
opts.description: Disable At(...) rewriting as In(...)/Old(...) in symexe mode

opts.name: stats
opts.description: Collect verification statistics

opts.name: par
opts.description: Enable parallelization (with CPU cores percentage to use)

opts.name: branchPar
opts.description: Enable branch parallelization

opts.name: branchParReturn
opts.description: Only use branch parallelization if all branches return

opts.name: branchPredNum
opts.description: Branch parallelization prediction minimum number of branches

opts.name: branchPredComplexity
opts.description: Branch parallelization prediction statement complexity

opts.name: rwPar
opts.description: Enable rewriting parallelization

opts.name: dontSplitFunQuant
opts.description: Do not force splitting in quantifiers and proof functions derived from @strictpure methods

opts.name: splitAll
opts.description: Split all

opts.name: splitContract
opts.description: Split on contract cases

opts.name: splitIf
opts.description: Split on if-conditional expressions and statements

opts.name: splitMatch
opts.description: Split on match expressions and statements

opts.name: rwMax
opts.description: Maximum number of rewriting

opts.name: rwTrace
opts.description: Disable rewriting trace

opts.name: rwEvalTrace
opts.description: Disable evaluation rewriting trace

opts.name: elideEncoding
opts.description: Strip out SMT2 encoding in feedback

opts.name: rawInscription
opts.description: Use raw sequent/sat preamble inscription

opts.name: rlimit
opts.description: SMT2 solver resource limit

opts.name: sequential
opts.description: Disable SMT2 solvers parallelization

opts.name: simplify
opts.description: Simplify SMT2 query (experimental)

opts.name: smt2SatConfigs
opts.description: SMT2 configurations for satisfiability queries

opts.name: smt2ValidConfigs
opts.description: SMT2 configurations for validity queries

opts.name: satTimeout
opts.description: Use validity checking timeout for satisfiability checking (otherwise: 500ms)

opts.name: timeout
opts.description: Timeout (seconds) for validity checking

opts.name: searchPC
opts.description: Search path conditions first before employing SMT2 solvers when discharging VCs

opts.name: m2
opts.description: Local m2 repository (defaults to the user home's .m2 directory)

opts.name: target
opts.description: Publication target

opts.name: version
opts.description: Publication version (defaults to using git commit date, time, and abbreviated hash)

opts.description: Ignore runtime library dependency version when detecting changes

opts.name: memory
opts.description: Memory size in kilobytes

opts.name: erase
opts.description: Securely erase memory chunks as they are reclaimed

opts.name: depth
opts.description: Maximum expression depth to coalesce (0 means unbounded)

opts.name: runtimeCheck
opts.description: Enable implicit and explicit runtime assertion checking

opts.name: stackTrace
opts.description: Enable call stack tracing

opts.name: copy
opts.description: The maximum number of bytes per cycle for memory copy operation

opts.name: printSize
opts.description: Printing console buffer size in kilobytes (rounded up to a power of 2)

opts.name: output
opts.description: Output directory synthesized files

opts.name: axi4
opts.description: Enable AXI4 interface

opts.name: customDivRem
opts.description: Enable custom division and remainder implementations

opts.name: verbose
opts.description: Enable verbose mode

opts.name: bitWidth
opts.description: Default bit-width for unbounded integer types (e.g., Z)

opts.name: projectName
opts.description: Project name

opts.name: customArraySizes
opts.description: Custom maximum sequence sizes, each in the form of <type>=<size>, where <type> is either IS[,], MS[,], ISZ[], MSZ[], or ZS with fully qualified index and element types where applicable

opts.name: maxArraySize
opts.description: Default maximum sequence size

opts.name: maxStringSize
opts.description: Maximum string size

opts.name: save
opts.description: Path to save type information to (outline should not be enabled)

opts.name: load
opts.description: Path to load type information from

opts.name: customConstants
opts.description: Custom constant for object variables, each in the form of <name>=<lit>, where <name> is a qualified name of an object var and <lit> is a Slang literal expression
